Justine Henin, a former world number one tennis player, has announced that she will make a comeback to competitive tennis after a long break of almost three years. Henin, a seven-time Grand Slam singles champion, last played at the Australian Open in January 2010, where she suffered a shocking defeat in the second round. However, she has now decided to return to the court in time for the 2015 Australian Open, which will be held in Melbourne next month. Henin's comeback will be a huge boost for women's tennis, which has been lacking in star quality since her retirement.

The 30-year-old Belgian player, who is a mother of two children, has been practicing hard in recent weeks and is determined to make a successful return to the court. Her coach, Carlos Rodriguez, has revealed that she is well on her way to being fit and ready for the challenges that lie ahead. Henin's presence in the Australian Open will add extra spice to an event that already promises to be one of the most exciting in recent times, with Serena Williams, Maria Sharapova, and Victoria Azarenka among the leading contenders.

Henin's decision to return to tennis has been greeted with immense enthusiasm by fans and players alike. Her remarkable talent and fighting spirit have always made her a crowd favorite, and her comeback is sure to generate huge interest among tennis enthusiasts around the world. Many analysts believe that she could be a serious contender for the Australian Open title, given her vast experience and excellent record in Melbourne.

As a teenager, Henin won the Australian Open in 2003 and went on to capture four more Grand Slam titles that year. She became world number one in May that year and retained the top ranking for an impressive 81 weeks. Her other major titles include two French Open titles, two Wimbledon titles, and one US Open title. She retired from tennis in May 2010 after winning her seventh Grand Slam title at the Italian Open.

Henin's return to competitive tennis will be a huge boost for the women's game, which has been missing her presence in recent years. Her fans will be hoping that she can rediscover her magic touch and add more glory to her already illustrious career.

Manager Steve McClaren has urged his Derby County team to secure first place in their UEFA Cup group when they face Belgian side Club Brugge on Thursday night. The Rams currently sit atop Group D with nine points, but second-placed Brugge are only one point behind after four matches. A win for either team would guarantee progression to the next round, but victory for Derby would see them finish as group winners and avoid tougher opposition in the knockout stages. McClaren said: "It's an important game because we want to go through as group winners if possible." He added that his squad was looking forward to the challenge ahead, saying:"We've got some good players who can hurt any opponent - it will be tough match against strong opponents, but I believe my boys have what it takes to get positive result"

LONDON - A leaked email has revealed that Conservative Party officials have drawn up a "hit list" of Liberal Democrat MPs who they believe could be vulnerable in the upcoming general election.

The email, sent by a Conservative Party activist and obtained by the BBC, contains a list of 33 Lib Dem MPs, with notes on their electoral strengths and weaknesses. It also includes suggestions for how the Tories can target these seats in order to gain ground in the election, which is expected to take place later this year.

While the email does not confirm that the Conservative Party has officially decided to target these specific MPs, it indicates that the party is considering a strategy that would effectively undermine the Lib Dems in their strongest constituencies.

The leak comes as the two parties continue to negotiate a potential coalition agreement following the Conservatives' failure to win an overall majority in the 2010 election. Despite the ongoing talks, tensions between the two parties remain high, with some Conservatives reportedly pushing for a more hardline approach in order to secure better terms for their party.

The Liberal Democrats have condemned the leaked email as "dirty politics" and have called on the Conservative Party to disavow the tactics outlined in the document. A spokesperson for the party said that the leak demonstrated the "true nature" of the Conservative Party and pointed to a "divisive and negative" approach to politics.

The Conservative Party has not yet commented on the leak or the contents of the email.

Malcolm Glazer, the billionaire owner of Manchester United football club, has died at the age of 85. Mr Glazer bought the club in 2005 for 790m and oversaw significant changes during his ownership. Here are some key points about him and his time at Old Trafford.

Who was Malcolm Glazer?
Mr Glazer was an American businessman who made his fortune through real estate and sports franchises. He owned the NFL's Tampa Bay Buccaneers and also had interests in other sporting organisations such as the NBA's Orlando Magic.
Why did he buy Manchester United?
At the time of the purchase, Sir Alex Ferguson was still manager and the team were one of the most successful in England and Europe. Mr Glazer saw the potential to increase revenue from commercial deals and expand the brand globally.
What impact did he have on the club?
Under Mr Glazer's ownership, Manchester United became one of the richest clubs in the world with revenues soaring above 500million per year. However, there were criticisms that ticket prices rose too high for many fans while debt levels increased significantly. The team continued to be successful under Sir Alex but struggled after his retirement.
Was he popular among supporters?
There were protests against Mr Glazer's ownership by fans due to concerns around ticketing policies and debts being piled onto the club. Some felt he put financial gain ahead of the team's success although others praised his investment in infrastructure like the training ground.
Did he have any children involved in the club?
Yes, two of Mr Glazer's sons - Avram and Joel - took up roles within the organisation. Avram served as executive vice-chairman before resigning in 2014 amid controversy surrounding a failed takeover bid whereas Joel remained until 2017 when he stepped down following criticism regarding the handling of player transfers.
In summary, Malcolm Glazer was an influential figure in Manchester United's history whose tenure as owner saw both successes and controversies. His legacy will continue to be debated amongst fans and experts alike.

Palo Alto, California-based technology giant Hewlett Packard (HP) has announced that it is shifting its focus towards more sustainable and clean energy solutions in an effort to address climate change concerns. The company's new initiative aims at providing communities with access to reliable sources of renewable energy in order to empower them and reduce their carbon footprint. 

During the announcement made by CEO Dion Weisler, he emphasized on how this transition aligns with the growing demand for cleaner technologies worldwide. He stated: "We believe that accessibility to green energies will have a profound impact on improving lives globally." To achieve this goal, they plan to invest billions into research & development as well as partnerships within communities all over the world. 

Moreover, some experts claim that such move could also prove beneficial economically speaking given rising electricity costs along with increasing regulations aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions across industries worldwide. This decision comes amidst mounting pressure from consumers who are becoming increasingly environmentally conscious about what companies stand for besides just producing quality products efficiently. 

Overall though many see HPs' latest venture not only bringing environmental benefits but boosting social economic growth too making sure there's'more power to the people'.

The Liberal Democrats have appointed a new director of elections and political research ahead of this year's local council elections, it has been announced. 

James Sloan will be responsible for overseeing campaign strategy and data analysis in what is seen as an important test of support for the party following its coalition government partnership with the Conservatives.

Mr Sloan joins from polling company BMG Research where he was head of politics and previously worked on campaigns for the Scottish National Party (SNP) and Labour Party.

In a statement, Lib Dem leader Sir Ed Davey said: I am delighted to welcome James to our team. He brings extensive experience and expertise that will help us fight these crucial elections.

This years polls are being viewed as an opportunity for parties to gauge public opinion amid ongoing uncertainty around Brexit and the coronavirus pandemic.

A senior banker has lost her claim of sexual discrimination against her former employer, a top financial firm in London. Emma Wilson, who previously served as the joint CEO of the firm, filed the claim in 2018, alleging that she was discriminated against because of her gender.

However, an employment tribunal in London has ruled in favor of the firm, stating that there was no evidence to support Ms. Wilson's claim. The tribunal also noted that Ms. Wilson was one of the highest-paid women in British finance and was not treated differently from her male counterparts.

Ms. Wilson's legal team has said they are considering appealing the decision. The financial firm has also issued a statement, rejecting the claim and stating its commitment to diversity and inclusion.

The case has garnered significant attention, with many viewing it as a test case for gender discrimination in the male-dominated finance industry. The ruling has sparked mixed reactions, with some praising the tribunal's decision while others argue that more needs to be done to address gender discrimination in the workplace.

The controversial hunt ban, which was introduced in 2005 to regulate hunting with dogs, has seen its public support dwindle over recent years, according to new research.
A survey conducted by YouGov found that while 51% of respondents supported the ban in 2006, this figure had dropped to 36% in 2019. The study also revealed that younger generations are less likely to back the measure compared to older age groups.
Critics of the ban argue that it unfairly targets traditional country pursuits and puts rural communities at risk of losing their way of life. However, supporters claim that it helps protect wildlife and prevent unnecessary suffering for animals.
Environmental campaigners have called on the government to review the effectiveness of the ban and consider alternative measures to tackle animal welfare concerns. A spokesperson for one group said: "It's clear that attitudes towards hunting with dogs have shifted significantly since the ban was first implemented, and we need to ensure that our laws keep pace with changing opinions."

The Swiss cement firm, Holcim, has announced a flurry of acquisitions in recent months, indicating a new push into emerging markets.

The company has purchased two cement plants in the Philippines for $90 million, and a majority stake in a cement plant in Morocco for an undisclosed sum. Holcim has also announced plans to build a new cement plant in India, at a cost of $250 million.

These acquisitions come as Holcim seeks to expand its footprint in rapidly growing markets, where demand for cement is expected to rise sharply in the coming years. The company is also looking to diversify its revenue streams away from its traditional European markets, where competition is high and margins are under pressure.

Holcim's CEO, Bernard Fontana, has said that the company is "well positioned to capitalize on the opportunities offered by the globalization of growth," and that the recent acquisitions are "a clear indication of our commitment to sustainable growth and enhancing shareholder value."

Analysts have welcomed the move, with some suggesting that Holcim is taking a page out of its rival Lafarge's playbook, which has been aggressively expanding its operations in emerging markets in recent years.

Scientists have developed a new technique that uses lasers to help bridge gaps in rural broadband networks. The technology, known as "point-to-point" (PtP) laser communication, works by transmitting data via a laser beam between two points, allowing for faster and more reliable internet connections in remote areas.

According to a recent study, more than half of the UK population still does not have access to superfast broadband, with many rural areas being left behind. This is partly due to the high costs involved in laying cables and installing infrastructure in remote locations.

However, the new PtP laser communication system could provide a solution to this problem. Using sophisticated optics and high-powered lasers, the system can transmit data over long distances without the need for physical cables or satellites.

The technology has already been successfully tested in several countries, including the US and Japan, where it has been used to provide high-speed internet connections to remote islands and mountainous regions.

In the UK, several companies are already working on implementing the technology, with one provider claiming that it can provide speeds of up to 10 Gbps - over 150 times faster than the current average UK broadband speed.

While the technology is still in its early stages, it is hoped that it could revolutionize the way that rural areas are connected to the internet, helping to bridge the digital divide and provide faster and more reliable broadband connections for everyone.

The automotive industry is set to revolutionize its approach to designing cars with the introduction of robotic pods that will handle most aspects of vehicle creation, from sketching initial designs to testing prototypes. This new technology has been in development for several years and is now being implemented by major automakers around the world.

According to experts, these advanced robots are capable of analyzing vast amounts of data related to consumer preferences, market trends, and engineering requirements. They can then use this information to generate multiple concept sketches within minutes, allowing designers to quickly explore different ideas without having to spend hours manually creating each one.

Furthermore, once a final sketch is selected, the same robotics system takes over the task of generating detailed 3D models which engineers can manipulate easily before moving onto physical prototype production using rapid manufacturing techniques like additive layer deposition or laser cutting.

This streamlined process promises significant cost savings while also ensuring greater accuracy throughout every stage of automobile manufacture - something that could ultimately lead to safer vehicles equipped with more innovative features than ever before.

While some critics argue that replacing human workers with machines may result in job losses across various industries including auto design, proponents point out that such advancements often create entirely new positions requiring specialized skills previously unavailable due to technological limitations.

Overall, it seems clear that automated pod systems represent an exciting step forward for both innovation and efficiency within the global motor trade, transforming how we conceive, develop & produce automobiles well into the future.

In an effort to improve disaster recovery efforts, charities and NGOs are turning to text messaging as a means of communication with affected communities. The use of mobile phones has become ubiquitous in modern society, making it an effective way to reach people quickly and efficiently during crisis situations.

During natural disasters such as hurricanes or earthquakes, traditional forms of communication like landlines and cell towers can be disrupted, leaving emergency responders without vital information about the needs of affected populations. Text messaging, however, is much more resilient and can often continue working even when other methods fail.

Charitable organizations have recognized this advantage and are now using SMS texts to provide critical updates on evacuation routes, shelter locations, and food distribution points. In addition, they may also send out surveys asking individuals about their specific needs so that aid can be targeted effectively. This type of two-way communication allows for a greater degree of coordination between relief workers and those impacted by disaster.

Perhaps most importantly, texting offers a highly scalable solution to managing large volumes of data generated during emergencies. With millions of messages being sent at once, humanitarian groups can gain valuable insights into patterns of behavior among displaced persons - everything from migration trends to healthcare access requirements. Such real-time feedback loops enable better decisionmaking overall, which ultimately saves lives.

Overall, the increasing reliance on technology amid catastrophe underscores how innovation is helping us adapt to emergent challenges facing humanity today. From advanced satellite imaging to cuttingedge analytics platforms capable of crunching vast amounts data within seconds flat, we stand evermore equipped tackle calamities both new ones yet unknown still lurking around corner..

In an effort to cut costs and improve efficiency, ABN AMRO, one of the largest banks in the Netherlands, has announced plans to lay off 2850 employees over the next three years. The decision comes as the banking industry faces increased competition from online financial services and declining demand for traditional banking products.

The job cuts will affect all areas of the bank's operations, with particular emphasis on reducing its presence in certain countries such as Brazil and mexico. However, the Bank assured that it would continue to invest in digital capabilities and innovation to meet changing customer needs.

"We recognize this is difficult news for our colleagues who are affected," said Rijkman Groenink, chairman of Abn Amro."But we must take decisive action to ensure long-term success", he added.

Union representatives have criticized the move, saying it could lead to further instability within the company and damage employee morale. They also called on management to provide more details about how the redundancies would be implemented and what support would be provided to those losing their jobs.

ABN AMRO, which was formed through a merger between two Dutch banks in 1991, employs around 48,000 people worldwide. It reported net income of 1.5 billion ($1.8 billion) last year but faced increasing pressure due to low interest rates and regulatory changes.

Lusaka, Zambia - As voters in Zambia head to the polls on August 12th for presidential elections, there is both confidence and caution among citizens as they choose their next leader. The incumbent Edgar Lungu has faced criticism over economic issues and corruption allegations, but he also points to development projects that have taken place during his tenure. His main opponent Hakainde Hichilema promises to create jobs and improve the economy if elected. However, some are concerned about potential political instability should Mr. Hichilema win after losing two previous bids for presidency. Despite these concerns, many Zambians hope this election will bring much-needed change to their country.

Fields of wheat sway with the breeze,
Geese honk, forming Vs in the sky,
Autumn's arrival cannot be denied.

Fruits ripen and sweeten on the vine,
Grapes cluster, juice running free,
Corn stalks tower, tall and green,
Nature's bounty, plump and keen.

Children laugh, playing with friends,
Days shorten, time marches on,
Evening arrives, cool and mellow,
Night brings dreams, the cycle begun.

Candles flicker, casting shadows,
Memories made, hearts are bold,
Starlight shimmers, moonbeams dance,
Life's sweet melody is unbosomed.

Home quite alone, I sit in darkness,
Silent walls my only companions.
Empty spaces echo memories,
Of laughter and joy that once resonated.

In this stillness, my thoughts run wild,
Like untamed horses on an open field.
They take me on a journey through time,
To memories of a happier chime.

The warmth of the sun on my skin,
The sound of waves crashing on the shore,
The laughter of children at play,
All these memories I hold dear.

But now I am home quite alone,
The silence is deafening, it's a cruel stone.
I miss the warmth of a lover's embrace,
The feeling of being truly alive.

So I sit in the darkness and wait,
For the morning light to start its gate.
Hoping that it will bring with it,
New memories to replace the old.

But until then, I am home quite alone,
With only my thoughts to keep me company,
And the memories that I can't replace,
Haunting me like ghosts in the night.

In quiet moments with my thoughts engaged,
I glimpse an inner light that leads me on,
A gentle voice within whispers truth and grace,
 My silent teacher who always seems to know.

When doubts assail or fears hold tight their grip,
This unseen presence brings peace like still small rain;
And in those dark nights when dreams disturb our sleep,
The wisdom gleaned from countless dawns remaineth deep.

So I embrace this sage whose love knows no bounds,
Who watches over all things young and mature alike,
With faith unwavering towards eternity's bound,
For He has marked each step since life first struck its spark.

Though never seen by mortal eyesight keen,
His essence fills every crevice unknown
An ever-present guide through winding paths we wend,
Whose teachings mold us into beings humbly adorned.

Oft times rebuked are vain imaginings false,
Replaced instead by virtues forged via trials true:
Patience endures as anger fades away too slow,-
 Humility bends low while pride meets defeat so new!

These lessons learned transcend worldly boundaries great,
As selflessness uproots ego left neglected state:-
Thus am I changed thanks to guidance forever mate,
Unaware if one day flesh shall reunite.

Oh infinite seer beyond spatial constrict!,
Pray continue guiding frail vessels lost at sea.
Through thy eternal gaze piercing mystery reveal'd,
May shadows cast aside unveiling heaven hereafter bequeath unto me ceaseless learning.

In the dark of night, when the world is still,
I close my eyes and let my mind unravel.
My thoughts take flight, like birds set free,
And in this place, I am not a captive.

I dream of sun-kissed fields and endless skies,
Of winds that whisper secrets just for me.
I dance in fields of wildflowers, untamed,
And feel the earth beneath me, alive.

My heart beats fast, my spirit soars,
As I am free, no longer bound by doors.
I leave my chains behind and let my soul
Take flight, to places unknown, untold.

In my dreams, I am not bound by fate,
But shape my own destiny with grace.
I am the master of my own fate,
And in this dream, I am set free.

In 1942, at Durfee Intermediate School,
A young mind by the name of Marius de Gas,
Began to teach art and science with skill,
Bringing creativity and knowledge to fill.

With brush in hand and passion in heart,
He guided his students on journeys afar,
To worlds of imagination and wonder,
Where they could explore and create without border.

From sketching portraits to studying the stars,
Degas' lessons were never dull or sparse,
His enthusiasm contagious, inspiring,
The love for learning that he imparted endures.

Through the years, his legacy has grown,
As generations have been touched by his throne,
And though Marius DeGas may no longer be here,
His teachings continue to inspire fearlessly.

For art and science are forever entwined,
And through their union, we find divine,
The beauty and wonders of this world around us,
Thanks to Monsieur Degree's dedication profound.

Oh, summer! How you dazzle and delight
With golden days so bright and pure in sight
Bright rays that warm our skin with joyous might
A season born to chase away all night's bite

The scent of blooms abounds where'er we go 
Their colors bold; an artist's masterpiece show With butterflies as playful as can be 
They dance amidst nature's sweet symphony In fields of green swaying softly I see 

An azure sky without clouds ever lowly 
Reflects earth below upon water gently Flow rivers merge seas meet merging one wholly 
 As sun sets dusks come calling peacefully 

And nights under stars twinkling above 
 Bring fireside chats shared dreams love alive
 The soul dances free on whisper'd breeze Answering summer's call now set release

Happy birthday, baby girl,
You light up our world with your smile,
You bring joy to our hearts,
You are our shining star.

We celebrate your first year,
And all the milestones you've achieved,
Your first steps, your first words,
All the precious moments we've shared.

You are our everything,
Our little bundle of joy,
Our hearts beat for you,
Our love for you will never end.

So on this special day,
We want you to know,
How much we love you,
And how grateful we are to be your mommy and daddy.

May your birthday be filled with love,
Laughter, and all the happiness,
May you grow up to be strong,
And never lose your innocence.

Happy birthday, baby girl,
We love you more than words can say,
And we promise to always be there,
To guide you and protect you every day.

Just 22 miles of water,
A stretch of sea that's so narrow,
Yet it separates two lands,
Two nations with different stories.

On one side, there's the bustling city,
A land of skyscrapers and lights,
Where people rush to make a living,
And dreams are made at night.

On the other side, there's a village,
A place where time seems to stand still,
Where the waves crash against the shore,
And the seagulls call out for a fill.

Yet, despite the differences,
The distance that seems to divide,
There's a connection that still remains,
A bond that can never be denied.

For in the hearts of those who live there,
The love for their home still thrives,
And they know that no matter the distance,
Their bond with the other side will never divide.

So let us remember, my friend,
That just 22 miles of water,
Can never stop the love and connection,
That still remains, and will never end.

In her arms, once so small and delicate,  
Now stands a young woman tall with grace.  
As she gazes upon her daughter's face,  
Memories flood like an endless sea race.

The laughter, tears, joys that they shared,   
First steps taken in faith without fear;    All these moments now come to mind     With each feature etched on this wondrous find.

Her eyes hold wisdom beyond their years,      Yet still retain childlike innocence as well.       This mother knows what it means to be strong        And also how important is vulnerability at length.

She sees herself reflected within those orbs          Which look back full of love unconditionally            For all lifes ups & downs                  They stand together hand-in-hand tightly.

Oh, how time flies when you're having fun!         But amidst chaos there lies order undone           For every ending marks another new beginning              That leads us ever onward towards our destiny won.

So let us cherish each moment we share             Embrace change while holding steadfastly thereto               For though our paths may diverge temporarily                Ultimately, our bond shall forever grow stronger thereby.

We gather 'round the table, a family united
Thanksgiving prayers on our lips, hearts full of gratitude
For the love that binds us, for the memories we share
For the laughter and tears, for the joy that's so rare

We give thanks for the years, for the blessings we've known
For the comfort and peace, for the home where we've grown
For the love that's so strong, for the bond that will last
For the family we call our own, our forever task

We ask for your blessings, Lord, on this special day
For the food on our plates, for the love in our way
For the chance to be together, for the time we have now
For the memories we'll make, for the love that will grow

So let this Thanksgiving, our hearts be filled with joy
Let us remember the love, that's always shining bright
Let us cherish the moments, and hold them close to our hearts
Let us give thanks for the family, that we hold so dear.

Idioms, they're quite the trick,
Funny words that we don't always quick,
"It's raining cats and dogs" we say,
But what about "goosebumps" on our arms in dismay?

"Break a leg" we say before a show,
But what about "butterflies" in our tummy, oh so slow?
"Bite the bullet" when we face our fears,
But "butterfly" when love is near, oh so clear.

Idioms, they're all around,
In every language, ground,
They add color to our words,
And make our sentences sound absurd.

So let's embrace these funny words,
And use them with no fear,
For without them, our language would be dull,
And our thoughts, unexpressed, forever sealed.

In waters deep and blue, there lived a child  
Whose laughter echoed through waves that swirled   
Her golden hair like sun-kissed silk unfurled  
As she danced with sea creatures in their world 

She spoke to mermaids who sang her lullabies    
Composed by Neptune's own triton band     
And dolphins leapt from ocean's vast expanse      
To play hide 'n' seek beneath her sandaled land 

But one day came a ship bearing sailors bold       
Who caught sight of this enchanting wanderer         
They tried to snatch away what they could hold        
Yet all were left with was salt upon their fingers 

For when they dragged ashore the little maid          
All life drained out as water did retreat           
No more would songs fill air or seaside glade            
Only silence now for eternity awaited 

So let us honor still where once she played             
This lost soul bound forevermore to tides              
May we remember well our brief time on display               
Beneath an azure sky before it fades and hides

Hand in hand, we stroll through life's grand pageant,  
Our love like an anchor that keeps us steady and true;   
Through joyous moments as well as dark days spent,  
We walk together with hearts entwined ever so tightly. 

The world around may be full of strife or confusion,  
But within our souls there is peace for all seasons;  
For when two hearts beat as one beneath heavens bright sun,  
Nothing can tear them apart until time has run its course. 

So let us cherish each step along this winding path,  
Embrace every challenge fate throws at our doorstep:  
Together stronga force to reckon with none,    
Unbreakable bonds forged from deep inside heart-homes. 

And should darkness try once more to shroud skies above,  
Let it find no chink nor crack where light cannot shine brightly;  
Because you are mine now till eternity flows,  
My dearest friend turned lover who walks by my side finely. 

Oh! What blissful fortune fell upon me that day  
When I found thee amidst chaos' wild fray?  
Now forever bound on paths untrodden before,  
I revel in joys shared while walking armored henceforward. 

Thus shall we traverse realms unseen yet uncharted too,  
Armor clad against adversity which threatens new; 
With trusty hands clasping tight what matters most truly,  
No storm fierce enough to shatter bond between us anew. 

In times gone past they say lovers walked under moonlit sky,  
Whispering sweet words meant only for ears longing reply;     
Yet here today such romance seems but distant memory fleeting,  
Replaced instead by sturdy strides towards destiny meeting. 

Still though echoes linger soft whispers carried aloft breeze divine,  
Reminding both partners steadfastness required always thus far ahead remains;      That even if shadows encroach threatening paradise regained,  
Two spirits intertwining form impenetrable shield never failing guardedly. 

Therefore go forth brave warriors armed faithfulness eternal kindred spirit bestowal, vanquishing doubt despair wherever journey leads ye further still deeper union mystical sacred alliance hallowed ground consecrated vows

In this land where freedom rings, 
There's sadness in my heart that clings; 
For though I have no chains to wear, 
My soul is bound by fear and care. 

I walk with purpose through these streets, 
But inside feel lost and beat; 
The weight of responsibility 
Is more than any can bear or meet. 

To be free from tyranny's grip  
Was once our nation's grandest trip: 
Now we must find another way   
Than brute force for truth to sway. 

We strive towards equality true  
 
But how? What path will lead us there?, 
As divisions deepen day after year    
And hateful words become too dear. 

Oh America! Once great and bold     
Yet now adrift on shifting sands      
Of political strife unending       
 
 And social media-fueled misunderstandings' hands. 

So tell me, what does it mean indeed         
To live in such a sad state of freedom?          
Whereoncewe sought unity instead           
 Nowfindourselves divided like never before,            and bereft.

The sun rises on June 4th, 1989  
A day that will forever be remembered with dread   
In Tiananmen Square, students gather and protest    
Against corruption and for democracy they yearn   
Tanks roll in, armed forces take control      
Blood is shed as violence erupts like a volcano's roar     
China stands still, mourning its lost souls          
Freedom fighters or traitors? The world debates           
Thirty years later, memories linger               
Of hope crushed by oppression under Mao's rule            
But amidst the pain lies resilience              
As China continues to evolve into something new             
And though justice may have been delayed         
The spirit of freedom shall never fade away.

Oh sea, you are vast and deep, 
A mystery to those who dwell on land. 
Your waves crash against shore with such force, 
Yet in their retreat they leave some sort of lore. 

The seagulls call out as if from above, 
Their cries echoing through waters unfathomed. 
You hide treasures that only brave hearts seek, 
Shimmery pearls encased within oysters meek.
  
At twilight your colors start changing shades: 
Ruby red blending into indigo blurs - 
An unforgettable sight for all mortal men; 
No painting could ever quite convey it again. 
   
Sailors sailed upon thee eons past... 
All searching love or fortune at last! 
Some found what they sought while others met fate worse than death-- 
Lost forevermore beneath thy watery breath.
    
And though mankind may strive to conquer Earth's every cranny now,...

Her head perhaps of an angel,
Yet her heart was mortal and frail.
Tender thoughts and dreams unfurled
In the sanctuary of her soul.

But life had dealt her harsh blows,
Tumbling her from grace to disgrace.
She soared high and touched the stars,
Yet she stumbled in the mire.

Her smile perhaps could heal,
And her touch perhaps could feel,
The gentle warmth of her love,
The purity of her zeal.

But the world had turned cold,
And her light was fading fast.
She searched for love in the void,
But found only desperation and waste.

Yet still she held on to hope,
Like a feather drifting in the breeze.
She dreamed of a better life,
And held tight to her convictions with ease.

Her head perhaps of an angel,
Yet her spirit would never break.
For she knew that one day she'd soar,
And her wings would take her far.

And when that day arrived,
She would spread her feathers wide.
To embrace the world with love,
And spread her light until the end of time.

An anger born from hurt and pain,
Festering deep within the brain;
It simmers low until it boils,
And then its venom spills like oil.

From frustration's fiery flame,
Arise resentment and disdain:
Two spirits that do feed on wrath,
To fuel their endless reign in mans heart each day they are fed with hate.
But there is medicine for this ailment so dire,
A cure to calm the stormy sea inside,
For those who seek it out with all their might,
They'll find peace waiting at life's final light.

Forgiveness is the balm that heals,
Washing clean the wounds inflicted by fools or knaves -
Its power can transform our souls,
Bringing love where once was only scowls.
By practicing patience every step along the way,
We learn to curb our tongues before we say something wrong  
These two virtues walk hand-in-hand together today.
So let us choose forgiveness as tomorrow's remedy.

Gone are the days when I used to play,  
In fields where sunflowers swayed in every hue;   
When laughter echoed through gardens and trees,- 
 Oh! my childhood - how simple it was then life be-gan.. 
Days were spent with friends beneath skies so blue,    
 
Clasping hands while dancing round maypoles we stood ;  Oh' memories that thrill me still anew!     Twas joy untold as twilight slowly drew nigh.   
My heart echoes now thy tones, sweet songs melodious,       Those golden hours come back like voices from above          And whispers soft across intervening years--           Fond dreams which cluster 'round thee ev'rywhere!.

The fire crackles and spits, casting flickering light on the room,  
As an old man sits in his rocking chair with a sigh,   
Outside the wind howls through the trees like a ghostly serenade,    
Making the windows rattle as if to join in the tune,     
Snowflakes dance outside, twirling gracefully down from above,      
A winter wonderland awaits for him just beyond his doorstep,       
But tonight he'll stay put by the warmth of this hearth so dear,        
Memories flood back as he gazes into the flames' warm embrace,         
Of childhood winters long past when life was simpler than it seems,          
Sledding hills covered in snow that seemed endless at the time,           
Skating ponds frozen solid where laughter echoed without rhyme or reason why,            
Hot chocolate warmed hands wrapped around mugs steaming up cold little noses,             
Christmases filled with joy even though they were simple affairs,

In the twilight of my mind,
A created memory resides,
A place where dreams and thoughts combine,
A world that only I can find.

It's a place where I can be myself,
A world where I can breathe and live,
A space where I can find relief,
From the burdens that I carry every day.

In this memory, I am free to roam,
To laugh, to love, to feel at home,
To be myself, without any shame,
To be who I truly am, and to proclaim.

It's a place where I can be me,
Where I can be free, and where I can be,
A world that I can always see,
A created memory, so pure and free.

When the boys come home, the air is filled with joy,
The streets are bustling, the noise is like a noisy toy.

The girls run to meet them, their hearts filled with delight,
Hugs and kisses, tears and laughter, the welcome sight.

The mothers cook their favorite meals, the fathers pour the beer,
The family gathers 'round, the table is filled with cheer.

The stories they share, the battles they fought,
The memories they make, the love they bring,

When the boys come home, the world is a brighter place,
Their bravery and sacrifice, their courage and grace,

Fill our hearts with pride and gratitude,
For the men who protect us, for the heroes who save us,

We thank you for your service, we honor your name,
When the boys come home, our hearts are filled with love and fame.

Modern Indian English poetry, with its diverse themes and styles,
represents but a fraction of the vast and complex Indian culture.
It speaks of the struggles and triumphs, the joys and sorrows,
of those who have embraced a language that is not their own.

It captures the essence of a nation that is constantly evolving,
a nation that is both ancient and modern, traditional and progressive.
It explores the complexities of identity, the search for meaning,
and the search for a sense of belonging in a rapidly changing world.

It is a poetry that is rooted in the rich cultural heritage of India,
yet it is not bound by the conventions of the past.
It is a poetry that is open to experimentation, that is not afraid to take risks,
that is willing to push the boundaries of what is considered acceptable.

It is a poetry that reflects the diversity of India,
a poetry that is as varied and vibrant as the people who create it.
It is a poetry that is deeply rooted in the Indian cultural ethos,
yet it is not afraid to engage with the global discourse.

It is a poetry that represents the hopes and dreams,
the aspirations and struggles of the Indian people,
a poetry that is a true reflection of the Indian spirit.

The animal, a creature of wild and free,
With fur or feathers, scales or wings,
In forests, deserts, oceans deep,
Its presence echoes through the things we're given to keep.

It moves with grace, with stealth, with speed,
And in its eyes, we glimpse the need
To roam and hunt and seek its prey,
To live as nature meant it to stay.

For in the animal, we find
A purity of soul, unmind,
Untainted by the cares of man,
A life uncomplicated, unplanned.

Oh, the animal, how we admire,
The way it lives, and how it thrives,
A symbol of the earth's pure fire,
A guardian of the wild unknown.

Rainbow, a colorful dream  
Arcing across the sky so bright  
Red, orange, yellow, green, blue  
A visual feast for the eyes to hue  
  
A promise of hope and peace  
A symbol of God's love and release  
From the darkness and grey skies  
The rainbow shines to lift our spirits high  
  
A fleeting beauty we can't deny  
A transient wonder, a gift to the sky  
So let us cherish this ray of light  
And let it guide us through the fight  
To a brighter tomorrow, we'll strive  
With the rainbow's love and courage to thrive.

On this joyous day, as two hearts entwine,
A new life begins and old love shines bright.
In these sacred halls where vows are exchanged,
Let us remember what truly matters in our lives:
Love that endures through thick and thin;
Commitment to stand by one another's side,
Through laughter and tears until death does divide.

For marriage is more than just a ceremony,
It requires patience, understanding, loyalty, and mercy.
As you embark on this journey together, may your bond grow stronger each passing year,
And always keep God at the center of your union dear.

Remember to cherish every moment spent with loved ones near or far away,
For time flies swiftly like an eagle soaring high above its prey.
Hold hands often lest they slip from grasp too soon,
Kiss passionately for memories yet untold...
Laugh loudly when humor tickles deep within soul!

May peace fill up spaces between words left unsaid 
and misunderstandings be resolved before dawn breaks.
With open arms embrace differences which make y'all unique-
diversity enriches relationships beyond measure twice. 

So let today mark beginning rather ending point -
a fresh start filled w/promise hope & endless fun trips down memory lane!!
Congratulations newlyweds!!! May blessings rain upon both your heads :)

A man, a memory, a life well-lived,
A heart that beat with love, a soul that gave.

He walked this earth, a beacon bright,
A guiding light that shone so bright.

His laughter echoed through the years,
A joy that filled the hearts of those who heard.

He faced life's trials with a steady hand,
A man of strength, a rock that stood so grand.

In memory of H, a man so dear,
We hold his love and spirit here.

For though he's gone, his memory lives on,
A legacy that will forever be gone.

And so we cherish every moment we had,
With a man who left an indelible mark.

A man in memory of H, so dear,
A life that touched us all, so very clear.

In the heart of the city, where shadows dwell,
A tale of woe, a story untold.
A soul consumed by darkness and despair,
A Gothic suicide, a tragic affair.

The clock strikes midnight, the moon hides its face,
As the protagonist takes a final embrace.
In a room adorned with cobwebs and dust,
A scene straight out of a gothic trust.

The curtains are drawn, the fire burns low,
As the protagonist bids their sorrows adieu.
With a final gasp, their body falls,
In a pool of darkness, their soul calls.

The world moves on, oblivious to their pain,
But in the heart of the city, their memory remains.
A Gothic suicide, a tragic tale,
Of a soul consumed by darkness and woe.

In love and poetry, we find meaning pure,
Emotions captured in verse with ease;
Heart's desires written on paper thin:
Poetry speaks louder than words ever could be seen.

Language strives to convey each thought within us concealed,
But only through rhymes can passion melt into feelings that are revealed -
Soft whispers echoing deep from chambers where dreams reside unseen;
The union between lovers bound by lines they write upon their skin or meadow green...and all is meant for eternity as one!

In the twilight of our love, I see  
The shadows of uncertainty that be  
A crescent moon that marks the end  
Of a journey that began in friendship's bend

We grew together like trees by a stream  
Roots entwined, branches reaching high  
Our love, oh how it bloomed and gleamed  
But like all things, it couldn't last forever and die

Now as we stand on the precipice  
Of what's to come, we can't be triflic  
For this graduation from a love poem  
Is but a stepping stone to another, more sublime

So let us part with fond memories  
Of moments sweet, of passion's ecstasies  
And as we go forward, may we find  
Love that lasts, that grows everkind

Farewell, my love, as we traverse  
Separate paths, we'll always remember  
The love we once shared, the passion, the blaze  
And in our hearts, it'll always be a beautiful, shimmering haze.

Ingredients: 
  1 pack of pancit palabok noodles or bihon 
  2 tablespoons oil 
  3 cloves garlic, minced 
  1/4 onion, chopped 
  200 grams shrimps, shelled and deveined 
  100 grams squid, cleaned and sliced 
  150 grams chicken breast, boiled and shredded 
  1 cup bean sprouts 
  1 small cabbage, chopped 
  1 medium sized carrot, peeled and julienned 
  1 red bell pepper, sliced 
  1 green chilli, slit lengthwise 
  1 cube palabok mix 
  Salt and black pepper to taste 
  Toppings: crushed peanuts, leeks, lime wedges 
 
Instructions: 
1. Cook the noodle according to package instructions until al dente then drain and set aside.

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup whole milk
- 1/2 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon lemon zest
- 1 cup fresh or frozen cranberries

Directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan and set aside.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.

3. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the softened butter until creamy.

4. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.

5. Mix in the flour mixture and milk in alternating batches, starting and ending with the flour mixture.

6. Stir in the lemon juice, lemon zest, and cranberries.

7. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

8. Cool the bread in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. Once cooled, slice and serve. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour
- 2 tbsp. granulated sugar
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
- 1/3 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract

Instructions:
1. Preheat your waffle iron.
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the whole wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs and then mix in the buttermilk, vegetable oil, raisins, and vanilla extract.
4. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
5. Pour the batter onto the preheated waffle iron and cook according to the manufacturer's instructions until the waffle is golden brown and crispy.
6. Serve the waffles hot with your favorite toppings such as butter, maple syrup, or fresh fruit. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Additional granulated sugar for coating

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350F (180C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.

3. Beat in the eggs one at a time, followed by the vanilla extract.

4. Gradually mix in the flour and salt until a dough forms.

5. Roll the dough into 1-inch (2.5 cm) balls and place them 2 inches (5 cm) apart on the prepared baking sheet.

6. Lightly flatten each cookie with the bottom of a glass dipped in additional sugar.

7. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.

8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. Once the cookies have cooled, you can store them in an airtight container for up to 5 days. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup peanut butter
- 1 cup creamy peanut butter
- 2 cups oats
- 1 cup chocolate chips
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup butter, melted
- 1 box cake mix (chocolate or vanilla)
- 1 jar frosting (any flavor)

Directions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

2. In a medium bowl, mix together the peanut butter, creamy peanut butter, and oats.

3. Add in the chocolate chips, milk, and vanilla extract. Mix well.

4. In a separate bowl, mix together the melted butter and cake mix according to the package instructions.

5. Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.

6. Scoop a small amount of batter into each liner, just enough to create a cup for the cookie filling.

7. Take a scooper or spoon of the cookie dough and place it in the center of the cupcake batter.

8. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the cupcake tops are set.

9. Let the cupcakes cool for a few minutes before frosting.

10. Frost the cupcakes with the jar frosting and enjoy your no-bake cookie stuffed cupcakes!

Note: You can also add in additional ingredients like nuts or shredded coconut to the cookie dough mixture to give it a little extra flavor.

Ingredients:
- 1 lb of shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 lb of beef tenderloin, sliced into medallions
- 1/4 cup of olive oil
- 1 tablespoon of paprika
- 1 tablespoon of cumin
- 1 tablespoon of chili powder
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons of butter
- 2 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup of white wine
- 1 tablespoon of chopped fresh parsley

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 400F.

2. In a bowl, mix together the olive oil, paprika, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.

3. Add the shrimp and beef medallions to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the spice mixture.

4. In a large oven-safe skillet, heat the butter and garlic over medium-high heat until the garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute.

5. Add the shrimp and beef to the skillet and sear for 2-3 minutes on each side until browned.

6. Pour the white wine into the skillet and bring to a boil, scraping the bottom of the skillet to loosen any browned bits.

7. Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the shrimp are pink and the beef is cooked to your desired level of doneness.

8. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve hot. Enjoy your Spicy Surf-and-Turf!

Ingredients:
- 1 octopus (about 2 pounds)
- 3 quarts water
- 1 tablespoon salt
- Lemon wedges, for serving
Instructions:
1. Rinse the octopus under cold running water and remove any visible tentacles or debris. 
2. In a large pot, bring 3 quarts of water to a boil over high heat. Add the octopus and salt, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer uncovered for 45 minutes to an hour until tender. The cooking time will depend on the size of your octopus. Check doneness by piercing with a fork  it should slide in easily. 
3. Remove from heat and let cool slightly before handling. Using tongs or gloves, gently pull off and discard the head along with inner membrane/beak pouch located inside the body cavity; this can sometimes be tough & bitter tasting. Cut remaining body into bite sized pieces if desired but leave attached tentacles intact as they are easy to eat that way! Serve warm accompanied lemon wedge(s). Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs. pork shoulder
- 1 cup mango juice
- 1/2 cup BBQ sauce
- 1/4 cup yellow mustard
- 2 tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 tsp. onion powder
- 1 tsp. paprika
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 12 slider buns
- Optional toppings: diced mango, pickled red onions, avocado slices

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 325F.

2. In a small bowl, mix together the mango juice, BBQ sauce, mustard, brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.

3. Place the pork shoulder in a slow cooker and pour the mango BBQ sauce mixture over the top. Use a brush to make sure the pork is fully coated.

4. Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 8-10 hours or until the pork is tender and falls apart easily when shredded.

5. Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred it using two forks.

6. Preheat the broiler.

7. Place the shredded pork on a baking sheet and broil for 5-7 minutes or until the edges are slightly charred.

8. Assemble the sliders by placing a spoonful of pulled pork on each bun and topping with diced mango, pickled red onions, and/or avocado slices.

9. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 6 large egg yolks
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 325F.

2. In a medium saucepan, combine the heavy cream, sugar, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture comes to a simmer.

3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool for 5 minutes.

4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and vanilla extract until well combined.

5. Slowly pour the hot cream mixture into the egg yolk mixture, whisking constantly to prevent the eggs from cooking.

6. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large measuring cup or pitcher.

7. Divide the mixture among six 6-ounce ramekins or custard cups.

8. Place the ramekins in a large baking dish and fill the dish with enough hot water to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.

9. Carefully transfer the baking dish to the oven and bake for about 45-50 minutes, or until the custards are set but still trembling in the center.

10. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let the custards cool in the water bath for 10 minutes.

11. Carefully remove the ramekins from the water bath and transfer them to a wire rack to cool to room temperature.

12. Refrigerate the custards for at least 2 hours, or until chilled and set.

13. Serve the custards chilled, garnished with fresh fruit or whipped cream, if desired. Enjoy!

Heres a recipe for my version of the Lofthouse Frosted Cookie:

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/4 cup whole milk

For the frosting:
- 2 cups powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1-2 tbsp whole milk
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

Directions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar together until creamy.
4. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the vanilla extract and milk.
5. Gradually stir in the dry ingredients until fully incorporated.
6. Using a cookie scoop or spoon, drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake for 11-13 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. For the frosting, in a medium bowl, beat the powdered sugar and butter together until smooth.
10. Add in the milk and vanilla extract, and mix until the frosting is creamy and spreadable.
11. Frost the cooled cookies and enjoy!

Persimmon Chiffon Pie with Gingersnap Crust Recipe:
Crust:
- 1 1/2 cups gingersnap cookie crumbs
- 3 tablespoons granulated sugar
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 9-inch pie dish

In a medium bowl, combine gingersnap cookie crumbs, sugar and melted butter until well mixed. Press the mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of the pie dish. Place in the refrigerator to set while preparing the filling.

Filling:
- 4 ripe Fuyu persimmons, peeled, seeded and pureed
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 3 large eggs, separated
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- 9-inch pie dish

In a large bowl, whisk together persimmon puree, sugar, flour, egg yolks, water, lemon juice, vanilla extract, cinnamon and ginger until smooth. In a separate large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the persimmon mixture until just combined.

Pour the filling into the prepared crust and smooth the top. Bake at 350F for 50-60 minutes, or until the filling is set. Cool to room temperature before slicing and serving.

Ingredients:
- 1 cup millet flour
- 1/2 cup almond flour
- 1/2 cup tapioca flour
- 1/2 cup coconut sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt
- zest of 2 lemons
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1/2 cup coconut oil, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup almond milk
- 1 tsp vanilla extract

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375F and line a muffin tin with paper liners.

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the millet flour, almond flour, tapioca flour, coconut sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

3. Add in the lemon zest, lemon juice, melted coconut oil, eggs, almond milk, and vanilla extract. Stir until well combined.

4. Spoon the batter into the muffin liners, filling each about 3/4 full.

5. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

6. Allow the muffins to cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

7. Serve and enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 4 cups powdered sugar
- 3-4 tablespoons meringue powder
- 3-4 tablespoons cold water
- Food coloring (optional)

Instructions:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine powdered sugar and meringue powder.

2. Add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, while mixing with an electric mixer on low speed.

3. Continue mixing until the icing reaches a stiff peak consistency.

4. If desired, add a few drops of food coloring and mix until well combined.

5. Transfer the icing to a piping bag fitted with a round tip (such as a #3 or #4).

6. Pipe the icing onto cookies or cupcakes in a rotating motion, starting at the edge and moving towards the center to create a circle shape.

7. Allow the icing to dry completely before handling or decorating further.

Note: This recipe can be doubled or tripled as needed for larger batches. If the icing begins to soften or lose its shape, simply refrigerate it for a few minutes to firm it up again.

Ingredients:
- 1 sheet of yuba (tofu skin)
- 2 tablespoons of sake
- 2 tablespoons of mirin
- 2 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon of sugar
- 1 tablespoon of water
- 1 tablespoon of grated ginger
- 1 tablespoon of sesame oil
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 teaspoon of ground black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
- 2 cups of cooked rice

Instructions:

1. In a small saucepan, combine sake, mirin, soy sauce, sugar, water, ginger, sesame oil, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Mix well and bring to a boil over medium heat.

2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

3. Add the sheet of yuba to the saucepan and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the yuba is softened.

4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the yuba ankake sauce cool down to room temperature.

5. In a large bowl, mix the cooked rice with the yuba ankake sauce until the rice is evenly coated.

6. Serve the yuba ankake sauce with rice (Kyoto obanzai style) in individual bowls, garnished with some grated ginger and sesame seeds if desired. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 cup of all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup of caster sugar
- 1/4 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon of salt
- 1/4 cup of cold butter
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup of milk
- 1/2 cup of dried cherries
- 1/4 cup of milk chocolate chips

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375F (190C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.

3. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients. Use a pastry cutter or your fingers to work the butter into the mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.

4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Add the wet mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until the dough comes together.

5. Fold in the dried cherries and milk chocolate chips.

6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to about 1/4 inch thickness. Use a cookie cutter or the rim of a glass to cut out circles.

7. Place the circles onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly crispy.

8. Allow the scrolls to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

9. Once cooled, enjoy your delicious Milk Chocolate Cherry Scrolls!

Ingredients:
- 1 large eggplant, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 2 zucchinis, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1 red bell pepper, seeded and diced
- 1 yellow onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (28 oz) crushed tomatoes
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tsp dried basil
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375F.

2. In a large bowl, toss eggplant and zucchini with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

3. Place the eggplant and zucchini on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.

4. In a large skillet, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

5. Add the diced bell pepper and cook for an additional 5 minutes.

6. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.

7. Add the roasted eggplant and zucchini to the skillet and stir to combine.

8. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, until the ratatouille is heated through and the flavors have melded together.

9. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve over pasta or as a side dish. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 cup dried apricots, chopped
- 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350F (180C). Line an 8-inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on two opposite sides for easy removal.

2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, oats, brown sugar, melted butter, and salt until well combined.

3. Press two-thirds of the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan, spreading it evenly with a spatula.

4. Sprinkle the chopped apricots and chocolate chips over the crust.

5. Crumble the remaining oat mixture over the top of the apricots and chocolate chips.

6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.

7. Allow the bars to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.

8. Lift the bars out of the pan using the parchment paper overhang and transfer to a cutting board. Use a sharp knife to slice into 16 bars.

9. Serve and enjoy! These Chocolate Chip Apricot Bars can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

Ingredients:
- 4 large ripe tomatoes, diced 
- 1/2 red onion, finely chopped 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced  
- 1 jalapeo pepper, seeded and finely chopped (optional)   
 -1 tablespoon fresh cilantro leaves 
    juice of half lime or lemon

 Instructions :
 
 Combine all the ingredients in mixing bowl. Mix well to combine. Let it sit at room temperature 30 minutes before serving so flavors can meld together. Serve with tortilla chips, on tacos as salsa or use is as marinade for chicken or fish. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 3 cups high-quality chocolate chips
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 1 cup whole milk
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
- 8 egg yolks

Instructions:

1. In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the chocolate chips, heavy cream, whole milk, and sugar.

2. Stir the mixture until the chocolate chips have melted and the sugar has dissolved.

3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the vanilla extract and egg yolks until well combined.

4. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 10 minutes.

5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.

6. Once the mixture has cooled, pour it into an ice cream maker and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions until the gelato has a smooth and creamy consistency.

7. Transfer the gelato to a freezer-safe container and freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.

8. Enjoy your delicious Chocolate Gelato Hotel Cipriani!

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs
- 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- Salt and black pepper, to taste
- 1 large English cucumber, thinly sliced
- 1 large red onion, thinly sliced
- 8-10 pitas, warmed
- Optional toppings: tahini sauce, pickles, hot sauce, and/or feta cheese

Instructions:

1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, lemon juice, olive oil, garlic, cumin, paprika, coriander, salt, and pepper. Mix well to coat the chicken evenly.

2. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 8 hours to allow the flavors to marinate.

3. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.

4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and shake off any excess. Discard the remaining marinade.

5. Grill the chicken for 6-8 minutes per side, or until cooked through and charred on the outside. Remove from the grill and let rest for a few minutes.

6. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saut the cucumber and onion over medium heat until softened and slightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.

7. To assemble the shawerma, slice the chicken into thin strips and place in the warmed pitas. Top with the sauted cucumber and onion, and any additional toppings of your choice. Serve immediately.

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken (about 4-5 lbs)
- 2 tbsp. olive oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 onion, quartered
- 2 carrots, peeled and sliced
- 2 celery stalks, sliced

Instructions:
1. Preheat your Dutch oven over medium heat until it's hot.
2. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels and place it in the Dutch oven, breast-side up.
3. Rub the olive oil over the chicken, and then sprinkle with salt, pepper, and paprika.
4. Add the minced garlic, quartered onion, sliced carrots, and sliced celery around the chicken in the Dutch oven.
5. Cover the Dutch oven and roast the chicken for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165F when measured with a meat thermometer.
6. Remove the Dutch oven from the heat and let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving it and serving.
7. Garnish with some fresh parsley and serve with your favorite sides.

Ingredients:
-2 small acorn squash
-4 ears of corn, husked
-2 tablespoons olive oil
-1/2 teaspoon salt
-1/4 teaspoon black pepper
-1/4 teaspoon paprika
-1/4 teaspoon cumin
-2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
-2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:

1. Preheat your oven to 400F (200C).

2. Cut the stem off each acorn squash and cut it in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds and stringy flesh. Drizzle the inside of each squash half with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the squash halves on a baking sheet, cut side up.

3. Place the corn on the cob on another baking sheet and drizzle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Sprinkle with paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Roast both the squash and corn in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender.

4. While the squash and corn are roasting, prepare the corn pudding. Remove the corn kernels from the cobs. In a mixing bowl, whisk together 2 eggs, 1 cup of milk, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Stir in the corn kernels and chopped parsley.

5. Once the squash and corn are done roasting, remove them from the oven and reduce the oven temperature to 350F (180C).

6. Scoop out some of the flesh from each squash half to make room for the corn pudding. Pour the corn pudding into each squash half. Sprinkle each with grated Parmesan cheese.

7. Return the squash to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the corn pudding is set and the cheese is melted and golden brown.

8. Serve the roasted corn pudding in acorn squash hot and enjoy!

Ingredients:

For the crust:
- 1 1/2 cups of graham cracker crumbs
- 1/4 cup of granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup of unsalted cashews, finely ground
- 1/4 cup of unsalted butter, melted

For the filling:
- 2 (8 oz) packages of cream cheese, softened
- 1 cup of granulated sugar
- 2 tbsp of all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp of vanilla extract
- 4 large eggs, room temperature
- 1 cup of sour cream
- 1/2 cup of heavy cream
- 1/2 cup of caramel sauce

For the topping:
- 1/2 cup of caramel sauce
- 1/2 cup of unsalted cashews, chopped

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 325F. Grease a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray and set aside.

2. In a medium bowl, mix together the graham cracker crumbs, granulated sugar, and finely ground cashews. Pour in the melted butter and mix until well combined.

3. Press the mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of the prepared pan. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Let cool while preparing the filling.

4. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add in the sugar, flour, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.

5. Add in the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the sour cream and heavy cream.

6. Pour the cheesecake filling over the cooled crust and smooth out the top.

7. Bake for 55-60 minutes or until the edges are set and the center slightly jiggles. Turn off the oven but leave the cheesecake inside for an additional 20 minutes.

8. Meanwhile, prepare the topping by heating the 1/2 cup of caramel sauce in the microwave for 20-30 seconds until pourable.

9. After the 20 minutes, remove the cheesecake from the oven and pour the hot caramel sauce over the top. Sprinkle with chopped cashews.

10. Let the cheesecake cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least

Ingredients:
- 1 roll of refrigerated sugar cookie dough
- 1 bag of miniature marshmallows
- 1 bag of semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375F.

2. Unroll the cookie dough and cut it into 24 equal-sized slices.

3. Place the slices onto an ungreased baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden.

4. While the cookies are baking, prepare the filling. In a saucepan, melt the chocolate chips and butter together over low heat, stirring constantly.

5. Once the cookies are done, remove them from the oven and immediately place a few miniature marshmallows on top of each cookie.

6. Return the cookies to the oven and bake for an additional 1-2 minutes or until the marshmallows are slightly melted.

7. Remove the cookies from the oven and carefully spread a spoonful of the melted chocolate mixture onto the bottom of one cookie.

8. Place another cookie on top of the chocolate to create a sandwich.

9. Repeat with the remaining cookies, marshmallows, and chocolate until all of the cookies are assembled.

10. Allow the cookies to cool and set for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious SMores Cookie Sandwiches!

Ingredients:

For the crust:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1/4 cup cold unsalted butter, diced
- 1/4 cup cold shortening, diced
- 3 to 5 tablespoons ice water

For the filling:
- 6 medium Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted

For the streusel topping:
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375F.

2. To make the crust, in a large bowl, whisk together the flour and honey. Add the diced butter and shortening, and use a pastry cutter or your fingers to work the fats into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, stirring with a fork until the dough comes together.

3. Press the dough into a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom, making sure it is evenly distributed across the bottom and sides. Use a fork to prick the bottom of the crust several times. Bake for 15-18 minutes, until the crust is lightly golden brown.

4. While the crust is baking, prepare the filling. In a large bowl, toss the sliced apples with the granulated sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg until well coated.

5. After the crust has baked, spread the melted butter over the bottom of the tart shell. Arrange the apple slices in concentric circles over the butter, starting from the outer edge and working towards the center.

6. To make the streusel topping, in a separate bowl, mix together the flour, rolled oats, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Add the melted butter and stir until well combined.

7. Sprinkle the streusel topping evenly over the apples.

8. Bake the tart for an additional 35-40 minutes, until the apples

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp ground cloves
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 stick unsalted butter, melted
- 6 medium apples, peeled, cored, and thinly sliced
- 1 box white cake mix
- 4 large eggs
- 1/3 cup vegetable oil
- 1 cup plain Greek yogurt

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease a 12-cup Bundt pan with cooking spray.

2. In a small bowl, mix together the sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt.

3. Pour the melted butter into the prepared Bundt pan, and sprinkle the sugar mixture evenly over the butter. Arrange the apple slices in a single layer over the sugar mixture.

4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake mix, eggs, oil, and Greek yogurt. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes.

5. Carefully pour the batter over the apples in the Bundt pan, making sure not to disturb the apple layer.

6. Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

7. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting it onto a serving plate.

8. Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with additional apple slices or a dusting of powdered sugar, if desired. Enjoy!

Ingredients:
- 1 package of frozen spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 cup feta cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 pie crust

Instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 350F (175C). 

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, feta cheese, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, eggs, garlic powder, and nutmeg. Mix well. 

3. Pour the mixture into the pie crust and smooth out the top. 

4. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the pie is set and the crust is golden brown. 

5. Let the pie cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. 

Enjoy your sweet and savory Sweet Spinach Pie!
